to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])

to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: He had laughed at those who died with prayers on their lips.
sentences.chinese: 他曾嘲笑过那些临刑前还在念念有词地做着祷告的人。

sentences.english: 'Abracadabra, ' said the conjuror as he pulled the rabbit from the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师口中念念有词，把兔子从礼帽中掏了出来。

sentences.english: Children, there are many teachers in our school. Do you like them? Who are they?
sentences.chinese: 教室里马上热闹起来，很多同学在念念有词。
